concept.title: Record Functions
concept.shortdesc: Use record functions to get information about a record, such as the data type of a field or the stage instance name for an error record.

conbody.p: functionsrecord functionsrecord functionsin the expression languageThe expression language provides the following record functions:

dlentry.dd: Returns the data type of a field.

Possible return values are:
Boolean
Char
Byte
Short
Integer
Long
Float
Double
Date
Datetime
Decimal
String
Byte-Array
Map
List
Returns the value of the field in the appropriate data type.
Returns the ID of the stage that created the record, typically an origin stage. Data is stored in the sourceId field of an error record.
Returns the instance name of the stage that created the record, typically an origin stage. Data is stored in the stageCreator field of an error record.

Returns the stages in the pipeline that processed a record. Data is stored in the stagesPath field of an error record. The field path uses the following format:<origin instance name>:<next stage instance name>:<next stage instance name>:...
